channel.title: Rohan Tulsiani Portfolio on Rohan Tulsiani
channel.description: Recent content in Rohan Tulsiani Portfolio on Rohan Tulsiani

item.title: Multiplayer Arena Battler Game
item.description: Built an Arena Battler game that supports both UDP & TCP networking, then built a complete Tribes Networking stack on top of both protocols. Overall, a pretty well-rounded project that required knowledge about the CG pipeline, networking, debug visualizations, and more

item.title: Game Engine in DX11
item.description: Game Engine written in DX11. Supports various common Engine features, such as Skeletal Animation, Post FX like Bloom and Gaussian Blur, and more.

item.title: Mocap Animation Interpolator and Visualizer
item.description: Interpolates animations from CMU’s Motion Capture Database with Linear Euler, Bezier Euler, SLERP Quaternion, and Bezier SLERP Quaternion. Then, a Visualizer program can render those animations in a viewer complete with a scrubbable timeline, various rendering toggles, skeleton debug visualizations, and more.

item.title: Monte-Carlo Raytracer
item.description: Raytracer that supports both standard Phong shading and a slightly more complex paradigm using area-lights and a Physically Based BDRF. Also, includes Bounding Volume Hiearchies, Multithreading, Recursive Reflection, Soft Shadows, and Antialiasing.

item.title: Shadow and Ambient Occlusion Demo
item.description: Implementation of Shadow Mapping with Percentage Closer Filtering (PCF) and Screen Space Ambient Occlusion (SSAO) in OpenGL.

item.title: Campfire LD46
item.description: Campfire is a 2D platformer where you carry a lamp through a forest. As your lamp dies out, you lose vision of your surroundings. Rush from campfire to campfire to keep your lamp alive as you make your way to the end.

item.title: Roller Coaster Simulation
item.description: Roller Coaster Simulation in OpenGL using custom file format to specify Catmull-Rom spline segments.

item.title: Jello Cube
item.description: Simulation of a 3D Jello Cube using a Mass-Spring System. Further, the user can pick simulation points on the Jello Cube with the mouse to apply an interaction force to it; this force can be dissipated across the cube with a user-configurable falloff.

item.title: Heightmap Terrain Renderer
item.description: Renders Heightmaps (Grayscale and RGB) in OpenGL, then allows the user to manipulate how that Heightmap is viewed in various ways.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Email: rohantulsiani@gmail.com YouTube Hosts the demo videos you will find in the Project section of my portfolio. GitHub Some of the projects in the Project section can be found on GitHub as public repositories. Non GitHub-hosted code samples available upon request.
